Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Vill du också göra världen lite bättre samtidigt som du får arbeta med den senaste teknikutvecklingen? Då är Sigma Industry Development rätt företag för dig.

Vi söker en erfaren Machine Learning Engineer som ska bygger avancerade AI-lösningar för bl.a. supply chain och demand forecasting. Uppdraget passar dig som vill kombinera data science, backendutveckling och MLOps .




Du kommer att:

Utveckla och produktionssätta maskininlärningsmodeller och ML-pipelines
Bygga robusta backendlösningar i Python, gärna med FastAPI
Arbeta nära verksamheten för att utveckla lösningar inom t.ex. supply chain och demand forecasting
Hantera stora mängder data (batch & stream) och säkra datakvalitet
Jobba med molntjänster, Google Cloud Platform med Vertex AI
Följa och implementera goda principer för DevOps, SRE och MLOps
Samarbeta tvärfunktionellt med utvecklare, data engineers och produktägare




Vi söker dig som har:

5+ års erfarenhet inom ML-engineering eller liknande roll
Erfarenhet och certifiering av GCP (Google Cloud Plattform)
Stark kodvana i moderna språk, särskilt Python (4+ år)
Erfarenhet av att bygga och skala ML-lösningar till produktion
God förståelse för AI/ML-tekniker och olika ramverk
Kunskap om SQL, DBT, och cloud storage-lösningar
Van att jobba med kravställning, designlösningar och teamkommunikation




Språkkunskaper

Svenska och engelska (i tal och skrift)




Om oss

Sigma Industry Development är ett teknik- och konsultbolag inom Sigmagruppen som hjälper både ledande svenska och internationella teknikföretag och innovativa och nytänkande start-ups och scale-ups. Vi verkar inom sektorer så som den gröna energisektorn, fordonsindustrin, transportindustrin, medtech, försvarsbranchen och hållbarhet.




Vår vision är att vara det ledande teknikkonsultbolaget och vår kultur präglas av familjär samhörighet där människan är i centrum. Med över 100 engagerade medarbetare är vi i en stark tillväxtfas. Vår kärnverksamhet ligger i konsultuppdrag ute hos kund, men vi har även ett in-house-team som arbetar uteslutande från kontoret. Precis som vårt namn antyder, är utveckling kärnan i allt vi gör och våra medarbetare engageras av att ta Sigma Industry Development till nästa nivå. Vår tillväxtresa fortsätter och vi behöver bli fler erfarna medarbetare inom projektledning!




Vi erbjuder

Vi är stora nog för att kunna erbjuda en bred kundbas och vi har ett gott rykte i branschen, samtidigt som vi är små nog att se dig som individ. För oss är gemenskap viktigt – här ska alla känna sig sedda och välkomna. Som en följd av detta har vi bland annat gemensamma sektionsaktiviteter, ett nätverk för kvinnor och icke-binära, ett mentorskapsprogam och utbildningar inom olika kompetensområden. Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla kan växa och utvecklas tillsammans. Vår ambition är att tillgodose konsultens önskemål gällande uppdragslängd, sektor och arbetsuppgifter. För oss är en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv en självklarhet och vi är stolta över att vara en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare. Givetvis har vi också kollektivavtal (via Almega).




Om Sigma Group

Sigma Industry Development AB (SID) är ett av sex dotterbolag som ingår i koncernen Sigma Industry East/North Group, vilka i sin tur ingår i Sigma Group (som ägs av familjekoncernen Danir AB). Läs mer om Sigma Industry Development HÄR och om Sigma Group på HÄR.

Utöver att vara del av ett företag som värnar om teknologisk utveckling, arbetar för en bättre miljö och som främjar jämställdhet, så är en viktig del av vår verksamhet socialt ansvarstagande. Mer information om detta hittar du HÄR.




Sista ansökningsdag

2025-04-22




Mer information:

Kristoffer Billqvist, Sektionschef

Sigma Industry Development, Stockholm, 070-810 20 82

kristoffer.billqvist@sigma.se

LinkedIn

Show more

Title: Applied Scientist - Pipeline Data Science
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta is one of the world’s leading companies with more than 27.000 employees in over 90 countries dedicated to our purpose: Bringing plant potential to life. Through world-class science, global reach and commitment to our customers we help to increase crop productivity, protect the environment and improve health and quality of life. For more information about us please go to www.syngenta.com.

Job Description

The Seeds Development department for Syngenta seeks a passionate candidate for a full-time position of:

Applied Scientist - Pipeline Data Science

Type: Permanent

Department: Seeds Development / Vegetables

Location: Enkhuizen - The Netherlands

Into action

Do you thrive at the intersection of data engineering, predictive analytics, and innovation? As our Applied Scientist - Pipeline Data Science, you will play a crucial role in designing scalable data solutions that drive actionable insights. By consolidating complex datasets into robust, efficient pipelines, you’ll empower teams to make better decisions and uncover new possibilities in plant breeding. This is your opportunity to work on impactful projects in a collaborative and cutting-edge environment where data drives transformation.

The challenge

Responsibilities

As an Applied Scientist, you’ll focus on building the infrastructure that makes data accessible, reliable, and actionable for diverse stakeholders. Your key responsibilities will include:


Building Scalable Data Pipelines: Design, implement, and optimize data pipelines that integrate and consolidate data from multiple sources, ensuring seamless data flow and availability.
Ensuring Data Quality and Reliability: Develop systems to track, monitor, and maintain the quality, consistency, and integrity of data to ensure robust outputs for analysis and decision-making.
Driving Data Modeling and Mining: Create and implement processes for advanced data modeling and mining to support innovative analytical approaches.
Collaborating Across Teams: Work closely with IT, applied data science teams, and business stakeholders to align data solutions with organizational goals, addressing unique data needs efficiently.
Identify opportunities to incorporate advanced analytics, including machine learning frameworks and cloud platforms to continuously improve predictive pipelines.
Influence adoption of prediction methods, contribute towards their integration in the breeding process and the transformation of breeding schemes


This role combines creativity and problem-solving with a focus on real-world applications. You’ll not only shape the way data is managed but also contribute to meaningful outcomes in plant breeding and sustainable agriculture. Every dataset you refine and every system you enhance will drive smarter decisions and impactful innovations.

Qualifications

Your profile

We’re Looking For a Driven And Detail-oriented Applied Scientist With a Master’s Degree In Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Or a Related Field. You Bring a Strong Mix Of Technical Expertise, Analytical Acumen, And a Collaborative Mindset


Programming: Proficiency in Python, R, and SQL. Experience in both relational and NoSQL databases.
Cloud Proficiency: Familiarity with AWS services and cloud infrastructure
Analytical Acumen: Exceptional analytical skills, with the ability to identify patterns and trends in large and diverse datasets and translate them into meaningful recommendations.
Collaboration & Communication: A strong team player who thrives in cross-functional settings and communicates technical concepts effectively to diverse stakeholders.
Additionally, hands-on experience with containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn), along with an interest in plant breeding or agricultural innovation, would make you an ideal fit for this role.


Take your chance!

Syngenta is proud of its unique culture and the values that are at the heart of it. We also foster a strong learning culture with plenty of opportunities for personal development. Why? Because our work matters! We offer a competitive salary package, flexible working hours and excellent benefits.

Are you ready to grow your career with us?
Show more

Take your chance!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re on the lookout for an experienced AI Data Scientist Consultant with a strong background in deep learning and time series analysis. If you're passionate about building intelligent systems that solve complex, real-world challenges and thrive in cross-functional teams, we want to hear from you.




🔍 What You’ll Do

Design, develop, and deploy AI solutions focused on time series analysis for business-critical applications
Fine-tune and optimize pre-trained language models and recurrent neural networks (RNNs) for specialized use cases
Build and maintain efficient data processing pipelines to support model training and inference
Implement and evaluate model deployment strategies in production environments
Collaborate closely with engineers, analysts, and stakeholders to identify opportunities for AI-driven innovation
Continuously monitor and improve model performance, accuracy, and efficiency
Stay up to date with the latest trends and research in AI, ML, and neural network architectures




✅ What We’re Looking For

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
3+ years of experience developing and deploying AI/ML solutions in production settings
Strong Python programming skills, including experience with NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, and SciPy
Expertise in PyTorch or TensorFlow, particularly for RNNs and custom neural network models
Proven experience with time series data management and analysis techniques
Solid understanding of object-oriented programming and software design patterns
Proficiency with version control tools (Git) and unit testing practices
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and cross-functional collaboration




⭐ Nice to Have

Experience with model compression techniques (e.g., pruning, quantization, distillation)
Hands-on knowledge of transformer models and large language models (LLMs)
Understanding of MLOps workflows and model lifecycle management
Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes)
Exposure to cloud ML services (AWS SageMaker, Azure ML, Google AI Platform)
Background in industrial or manufacturing environments is a strong plus




📩 Ready to bring AI to life? Apply now or reach out directly to join a forward-thinking team that's shaping the future of intelligent systems.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Descripción del empleo

En Veolia España buscamos incorporar un/a Data Scientist reportando al Director Information Systems and Technology para nuestras oficinas centrales en Madrid.

Si estás interesado/a en participar en el proceso de selección, ¡Inscríbete aquí!

Funciones


Diseño, desarrollo, optimización e implementación de modelos predictivos y algoritmos de IA para optimización energética utilizando Python, TensorFlow y Scikit-learn.
Programación y desarrollo de soluciones utilizando herramientas de vanguardia y tendencias actuales (Python, R, ...).
Diseño y mantenimiento de sistemas de monitoreo en tiempo real con integración IoT-SCADA y visualización en Qsense/Power BI/Grafana.
Análisis avanzado de datos de consumo energético y desarrollo de forecasting para optimización de costos.
Implementación de soluciones cloud (AWS/GCP/AZURE) para procesamiento de big data industrial
Creación y mantenimiento de dashboards y KPIs para seguimiento de eficiencia energética y sostenibilidad.


Se ofrece


Horario: Entrada flexible de 07:30 a 09:30
Modelo híbrido de trabajo.
Retribución flexible: Seguro médico, ticket restaurant, ticket guardería, tarjeta transporte.


Requisitos


Formación: Deseable grado Universitario en Ingeniería Informática, Licenciatura en Matemáticas, Fisica, o similares.
Experiencia: Al menos 2 años en las funciones anteriores
Idiomas: Inglés alto
Lugar de trabajo: c/ Santa Leonor, 39, Madrid


Información adicional

Como empresa inclusiva, Veolia está comprometida con la diversidad y valora todas las solicitudes sin discriminación.
Show more
HTML:
Descripción del empleo

En Veolia España buscamos incorporar un/a Data Scientist reportando al Director Information Systems and Technology para nuestras oficinas centrales en Madrid.

Si estás interesado/a en participar en el proceso de selección, ¡Inscríbete aquí!

Funciones

  • Diseño, desarrollo, optimización e implementación de modelos predictivos y algoritmos de IA para optimización energética utilizando Python, TensorFlow y Scikit-learn.
  • Programación y desarrollo de soluciones utilizando herramientas de vanguardia y tendencias actuales (Python, R, ...).
  • Diseño y mantenimiento de sistemas de monitoreo en tiempo real con integración IoT-SCADA y visualización en Qsense/Power BI/Grafana.
  • Análisis avanzado de datos de consumo energético y desarrollo de forecasting para optimización de costos.
  • Implementación de soluciones cloud (AWS/GCP/AZURE) para procesamiento de big data industrial
  • Creación y mantenimiento de dashboards y KPIs para seguimiento de eficiencia energética y sostenibilidad.

Se ofrece

  • Horario: Entrada flexible de 07:30 a 09:30
  • Modelo híbrido de trabajo.
  • Retribución flexible: Seguro médico, ticket restaurant, ticket guardería, tarjeta transporte.

Requisitos

  • Formación: Deseable grado Universitario en Ingeniería Informática, Licenciatura en Matemáticas, Fisica, o similares.
  • Experiencia: Al menos 2 años en las funciones anteriores
  • Idiomas: Inglés alto
  • Lugar de trabajo: c/ Santa Leonor, 39, Madrid

Información adicional

Como empresa inclusiva, Veolia está comprometida con la diversidad y valora todas las solicitudes sin discriminación.

gromadzić, rejestrować, analizować i nadzorować realizację wymagań użytkowników w zakresie tworzenia i rozwoju systemów i narzędzi Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych w ZUS.

Zakład Ubezpieczeń Społecznych jest pracodawcą przyjaznym osobom z niepełnosprawnościami. Stwarza pracownikom optymalne środowisko pracy, uwzględniając ich potrzeby. Istnieje możliwość dostosowania stanowiska pracy i jego wyposażenia do indywidualnych potrzeb osób z niepełnosprawnościami

Wyposażenie Stanowiska Pracy


sprzęt komputerowy,
sprzęt biurowy.


Warunki Wykonywania Pracy


spełniają warunki określone wymogami bhp i ppoż.,
polegają na obsłudze komputera powyżej 4 godzin na dobę,
konieczność poruszania się po całym obiekcie,
konieczność wykonywania pracy poza biurem,
konieczność odbywania podróży służbowych,
budynek 3-piętrowy z windą oraz pomieszczeniami sanitarnymi dostosowanymi do potrzeb osób niepełnosprawnych,
stanowisko pracy zlokalizowane w pomieszczeniach biurowych na 3- piętrze,
miejsce pracy dostosowane do osób poruszających się przy pomocy wózka inwalidzkiego,
wejście do budynku jest zorganizowane z poziomu chodnika,
drzwi przy wejściu do budynku otwierają się automatycznie,
w bezpośrednim sąsiedztwie wejścia do budynku znajdują się miejsca parkingowe dla osób z niepełnosprawnościami
Show more

Title: Fraud Data Scientist
HTML:
A SIBS presta serviços financeiros modernos, fiáveis e seguros a mais de 300 milhões de utilizadores, em três Continentes, processando anualmente mais de 4 mil milhões de transações.


Junta-te a nós nesta batalha do “bem contra o mal”, fazendo parte dos que ajudarão a proteger as transações dos cartões e comerciantes portugueses, dos 6 milhões de utilizadores do MB WAY, ATMs MULTIBANCO, home banking, ou mesmo as chamadas à API SIBS pelos developers e outras fintechs que querem disponibilizar a próxima geração de aplicações financeiras e de pagamento.


Irás ajudar a identificar os esquemas dos fraudsters, descobrir as ligações escondidas e criar modelos acionáveis que irão rastrear em tempo real mais de 25 milhões de transações por dia, no espaço de apenas alguns milissegundos.


Farás parte da equipa que fornece os melhores modelos de prevenção de fraude que permitem à SIBS oferecer uma experiência de pagamento de topo, ao mesmo tempo que garantimos que o dinheiro de todos está seguro. Irás ter acesso a uma grande infraestrutura de dados que aproveita o nosso data lake exclusivo e combina dados em todos os canais e serviços que monitorizamos, proporcionando uma visão completa e abrangente do sistema de pagamentos português.



Com o objetivo de reforçar o Núcleo de Machine Learning e Reporting, estamos a recrutar um Fraud Data Scientist, com o seguinte Perfil:

  • Mestrado ou Doutoramento em Engenharia Física, Informática, Eletrotécnica, Estatística, Matemática Aplicada ou similares:
  • Experiência prévia como Data Scientist, minima de 1/2 anos;
  • Excelentes capacidades de análise e resolução de problemas;
  • Capacidade de apresentar os seus resultados de forma concisa e adaptada a diferentes interlocutores;
  • Proficiência no ciclo completo de desenvolvimento de modelos (treino, afinação de modelos e generalização);
  • Proficiência em Python;
  • Conhecimentos de SQL e PySpark;
  • Conhecimentos de algoritmos baseados em modelos do tipo árvore (e.g. Random Forest, XGBoost, LGBM);
  • Conhecimento de tecnologias Big Data como Spark, Hadoop é valorizado;
  • Experiência com Databricks é valorizada;
  • Experiência com MLOps (monitorização de data drift) será valorizada;
  • Experiência em deteção de fraude será valorizada.


Função:

  • Desenvolver modelos de Machine Learning para deteção e prevenção de fraude e as suas estratégias de ação e decisão, incorporando contributos valiosos dos nossos Data Analysts:
  • Desenvolver e criar novas features preditivas baseadas em conhecimento de negócio e analítica avançada;
  • Desenhar e criar de novos produtos de IA que suportem e melhorem o nosso sistema de deteção de fraude e contribuam para um elevado nível de automatização de decisão às nossas operações;
  • Investigar e desenvolver algoritmos e soluções inovadoras que garantam o nosso elevado nível de capacidade de deteção de fraude;
  • Monitorizar a performance dos nossos modelos e estratégias de prevenção de fraude nos diversos produtos, serviços e geografias;
  • Trabalhar com as nossas equipas de operações e de gestão de serviço no ajuste e otimização dos modelos e estratégias de contenção de fraude;
  • Trabalhar com a nossa equipa de negócio em pedidos de cliente ajustando os nossos modelos de decisão para garantir o sucesso destas implementações;
  • Desafiar os atuais processos e estratégias de prevenção de fraude, promovendo soluções industrializáveis e de atuação automatizada;
  • Identificar novas fontes de dados que permitam adicionar valor ao nosso data lake;
  • Atuar como Data Scientist em equipas de projeto multidisciplinares e garantir que novos produtos e serviços estão alinhados com as melhores práticas e políticas de antifraude.


Benefícios:

  • Oportunidade de desenvolver projetos inovadores e de impacto direto na sociedade, numa empresa em crescimento e que aposta na inovação tecnológica há mais de 40 anos;
  • Acesso a um conjunto de benefícios atrativos: Subsídio de Alimentação superior aos valores médios de mercado; Pacote de Seguros; Pacote de Comunicações Móveis; Acesso a protocolos com diversos parceiros;
  • Perspectivas de desenvolvimento e crescimento profissional;
  • Excelente ambiente de trabalho.

współpracować przy projektowanie procesów ETL (Extract, Transform, Load), ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) w celu pozyskiwania, przetwarzania i ładowania danych z różnych źródeł do systemów klasy Hurtowni Danych

wielkopolskie

  • Nazwa stanowiska

Stanowisko ds. zarządzania obszarem BI i HD-specjalność inżynierii systemów Hurtowni Danych

  • Zadania

Zadania

  • zapewniać utrzymanie i rozwój architektury biznesowej i technicznej obszaru Hurtowni Danych
  • odpowiadać za proponowanie, budowanie i wdrażanie rozwiązań z zakresu technologii przetwarzania dużych zbiorów danych (Big Data), m.in. modelowania danych, projektowanie modelów ekstrakcji danych, projektowania i utrzymanie systemów magazynowania danych
  • odpowiadać za analizowanie wydajności sprzętu i oprogramowania w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • uczestniczyć w planowaniu inicjatyw i projektów mających na celu rozbudowę i optymalizację wykorzystywanych rozwiązań w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • współpracować przy projektowanie procesów ETL (Extract, Transform, Load), ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) w celu pozyskiwania, przetwarzania i ładowania danych z różnych źródeł do systemów klasy Hurtowni Danych
  • uczestniczyć w pracach projektowych, wdrożeniowych i testowych w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • wspierać użytkowników w ramach wdrożeń systemów i narzędzi w obszarze Hurtowni Danych
  • uczestniczyć w przygotowaniu planu rozwoju (roadmapy) dla środowiska Business Intelligence i Hurtowni Danych
  • proponować usprawnienia dla realizowanych procesów i zmiany w dokumentacji
  • Wymagania

Wymagania Niezbędne

  • wykształcenie wyższe
  • doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 1 rok (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)
  • staż pracy ogółem minimum 2 lata

Mile Widziane

  • wykształcenie wyższe (matematyka, informatyka, statystyka)
  • doświadczenie zawodowe minimum 2 lata (w pracy związanej z planowaniem, tworzeniem i rozwojem w obszarach Business Intelligence i\lub Hurtowni Danych)

Wymagania Dodatkowe

  • umiejętność obsługi programów MS Office
  • Znajomość języka SQL
  • orientacja na cel
  • orientacja na jakość
  • komunikacja
  • współpraca
  • elastyczność
  • nastawienie na rozwój
  • negocjowanie i wywieranie wpływu
  • podejmowanie decyzji
  • umiejętność rozwiązywania problemów
  • innowacyjność

Wymagane Dokumenty

  • CV
  • listu motywacyjnego
  • skan dokumentów potwierdzających wykształcenie
  • skan dokumentów potwierdzających wymagane doświadczenie zawodowe
  • skan świadectw pracy dokumentujących wymagany staż pracy lub zaświadczenie o zatrudnieniu zawierające okresy zatrudnienia, w przypadku pozostania w stosunku pracy

Dokumenty należy przesyłać poprzez formularz aplikacyjny 'Aplikuj', znajdujący się na dole oferty

Dodatkowe Informacje

  • proces rekrutacji obejmować będzie rozmowę kwalifikacyjną (przeprowadzoną w formie zdalnej przez komunikator internetowy - wywiad on-line) lub stacjonarnie
  • skontaktujemy się tylko z kandydatami spełniającymi wymagania formalne
  • oferty niekompletne tj. niezawierające skanu, któregokolwiek wymaganego dokumentu nie będą rozpatrywane
  • oferty przesłane po terminie nie będą rozpatrywane
  • miejscem świadczenia pracy będzie Centrala ZUS lub dowolny Oddział ZUS
  • możliwość pracy w trybie stacjonarnym, zdalnym lub hybrydowym
  • Termin, do którego należy składać dokumenty

12-02-2025

  • Oferujemy

Oferujemy

  • stabilne zatrudnienie na podstawie umowy o pracę
  • możliwość rozwoju zawodowego
  • bogaty pakiet świadczeń socjalnych
  • system premiowy

Zakład Ubezpieczeń Społecznych jest pracodawcą przyjaznym osobom z niepełnosprawnościami. Stwarza pracownikom optymalne środowisko pracy, uwzględniając ich potrzeby. Istnieje możliwość dostosowania stanowiska pracy i jego wyposażenia do indywidualnych potrzeb osób z niepełnosprawnościami

Wyposażenie Stanowiska Pracy

  • sprzęt komputerowy,
  • sprzęt biurowy.

Warunki Wykonywania Pracy

  • spełniają warunki określone wymogami bhp i ppoż.,
  • polegają na obsłudze komputera powyżej 4 godzin na dobę,
  • konieczność poruszania się po całym obiekcie,
  • konieczność wykonywania pracy poza biurem,
  • konieczność odbywania podróży służbowych,
  • budynek 3-piętrowy z windą oraz pomieszczeniami sanitarnymi dostosowanymi do potrzeb osób niepełnosprawnych,
  • stanowisko pracy zlokalizowane w pomieszczeniach biurowych na 3- piętrze,
  • miejsce pracy dostosowane do osób poruszających się przy pomocy wózka inwalidzkiego,
  • wejście do budynku jest zorganizowane z poziomu chodnika,
  • drzwi przy wejściu do budynku otwierają się automatycznie,
  • w bezpośrednim sąsiedztwie wejścia do budynku znajdują się miejsca parkingowe dla osób z niepełnosprawnościami

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are currently building a Global Data Science team for a Global Infectious Disease company. We are looking for 2 Data Science Contractors to help support the project.




You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

Analyze raw data: assessing quality and cleansing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 2 - 3 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling
Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools.

Title: Clinical Data Scientist
Place: Colmenar Viejo, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
At Claire Joster, we are seeking a highly motivated and experienced candidate to join the Clinical Pharmacology team within PharmaMar, a leading pharmaceutical company driving innovation in oncology research. The chosen candidate will play a key role in supporting the implementation of the Clinical Pharmacology and Early Development plan, focusing on drug pharmacodynamics (PD), pharmacokinetics (PK), and PK/PD relationships. This is a unique opportunity for someone with a strong background in pharmacology, computational biology, and statistical data analysis to contribute to cutting-edge clinical research.




Key Responsibilities:




Prepare and manage databases for PD, PK, and PK/PD analyses.
Conduct descriptive and statistical analyses of pharmacodynamic biomarkers and/or treatment response biomarkers.
Perform pharmacometric analyses, including non-compartmental analysis (NCA), population pharmacokinetics (popPK), population pharmacokinetics/pharmacodynamics (popPK/PD) analyses, physiologically based pharmacokinetic modelling (PBPK), PBPK/pharmacodynamic modelling (PBPK/PD), and exposure-response analysis.
Support the Clinical Pharmacology Department in designing and interpreting pharmacometric models to guide clinical development strategies.
Represent the Clinical Pharmacology Department in meetings with clinical pharmacology teams, as well as other clinical and preclinical departments.
Collaborate with departments such as Medical Oncology, Biostatistics, and Data Management to ensure robust data analysis and interpretation.
Provide support for bioanalysis oversight, including the management of biological samples and review/preparation of documents (e.g., validation protocols, PK tables, etc.).
Work closely with other pharmacometricians and pharmacologists, providing analytical and computational support.




Requirements:




Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy, Medicine, Biology, Biotechnology, or a related field, with strong knowledge of pharmacology, immunology, computational biology, bioinformatics, and biostatistics.
A master’s degree and/or a PhD in these fields is highly desirable.
Proficiency in English (spoken and written).
Strong programming skills in R and SAS for data analysis and automation.
Experience with other programming languages (e.g., Python, Bash) is a plus.
Experience in clinical research, particularly in pharmacology and immunology, including authoring scientific publications.
Knowledge of pharmacometric modeling software (e.g., NONMEM, PK-SIM, Monolix) and bioinformatics or systems biology.
Experience in bioanalysis and statistical analyses (descriptive, univariate, and multivariate).
Familiarity with Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS), genotyping analyses, bioinformatic pipelines, and pharmacogenetics.




What We Offer:




Competitive salary based on experience.
Permanent full-time contract with flexible start times.
Shorter working hours on Fridays.
Subsidized corporate cafeteria.
Stock plan.
Private health insurance.




PharmaMar is committed to promoting equal opportunities for all individuals, regardless of race, sex, gender, religion, or sexual orientation. We actively work to eliminate barriers to discrimination and foster a diverse and inclusive work environment.

Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Our mission at Netguru is to help entrepreneurs and innovators shape the world through beautiful software. We care about trust, taking ownership, and transparency. As a Certified B Corporation®, we offer a safe, inclusive and productive environment for all team members, and we're always open to feedback. If you want to work from home and be a full time employee, great! We want to create the right opportunities for you.

As an AI Engineer at Netguru, you will be:


Implementing Azure OpenAI API for applications
Implementing RAG systems
Working with open source models to fine-tune and apply them for clients
Experimenting with different ML techniques
Creating PoC, MVP of AI applications
Designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models
Leading AI project implementations
Collaborating with cross-disciplinary teams
Researching new techniques, models and approaches to apply AI in retail, healthcare, finance and general industries



Salary:

PLN 12 000 - 19 200/month Before Tax (Long-term contract (B2B))

PLN 10 000 - 16 000/month Gross (Contract of employment)

Requirements

Must have:


Previous experience with software development (ideally 2-5 years of commercial experience);
Strong proficiency in Python and relevant AI frameworks
Familiarity with PyTorch, Tensorflow;
Familiarity with OpenAI API, Azure OpenAI API;
Knowledge how RAG, embeddings, vector databases work;
Knowledge how GraphRAG work
Knolwedge of embeddings, reranking and database optimization for embeddings
Expierience with agentic workflow, how it works, how to define tools
Experience with frameworks like autogen (AI Agent), guidance (Structured information)
Experience in cloud-based AI development (e.g., AWS, Azure)
Experience with Firebase, Supabase;
Understanding of data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques;
Ability to lead technical projects and mentor junior engineers
Based in European Union
Excellent communication skills in English - both verbal and written (C1+)
Based in European Union


Nice to have:


Familiarity with open source GPT models, llama, mistral;
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop)
Examples in portfolio using ML models, e.g. GPT, Stable Diffusion etc.;
Industry-specific AI experience (e.g., healthcare, finance)
AI Certification like e.g. AI-900, AI-102



Benefits

In return, we offer:


Access to the WorkSmile platform offering benefits adapted to your preferences
Discounts on Apple products
One-time PLN 1000 home-office bonus for B2B contractors, and PLN 175 monthly lump sum (ryczałt) for remote employees
Various internal initiatives: webinars, knowledge sharing sessions, internal conferences


If you need any disability-related adaptation at any step of the recruitment process - simply let the recruiter know! We'd be happy to help.

Don't hesitate and apply right away! In case of questions - drop us a line at jobs@netguru.com!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Il nostro scopo?


Essere la fintech bank di riferimento per le micro e piccole imprese italiane, offrendo esperienze finanziarie digitali e innovative


Cosa abbiamo fatto fino ad ora?


Siamo una fintech bank che cresce velocissima! In soli quattro anni abbiamo ottenuto la licenza bancaria, raggiunto il breakeven, siamo stati tre volte tra LinkedIn Top Startups (al 1°, 2° e 3° posto), abbiamo lanciato 6 prodotti completamente digitali, superato i 20.000 clienti e un miliardo € di finanziamenti erogati. In poco tempo abbiamo costruito un brand giovane e solido.


Siamo 110+ AideXer: motivati, sperimentatori e pronti ad innovare il modo di fare banca!


Come Data Scientist sarai inserit* all’interno dell'area Data Science, a diretto riporto del Lead Data Scientist.


🚀Le tue attività

  • Contribuire all’R&D in Data Science applicata al lendingTech;
  • Collaborare con i business stakeholder di dominio individuando nuove aree di miglioramento e impiego fruttuoso di modelli di AI o soluzioni algoritmiche data-driven;
  • Progettare, testare e rilasciare modelli predittivi utilizzati real-time per le decisioni automatiche della Banca;
  • Contribuire allo sviluppo della Credit Decision Platform, la piattaforma che orchestra l’esecuzione real-time dei modelli durante l’onboarding di clienti prospettici;
  • Implementare – tramite best-practices di MLOps – il monitoraggio e/o la ricalibrazione dei modelli in produzione;
  • Preparare e mantenere un'adeguata documentazione sui modelli.


🧬Le tue caratteristiche

L’AideXer che fa per noi ha:

  • Una laurea magistrale in discipline STEM (Matematica, Fisica, Data Science, Computer Science);
  • Almeno un anno di esperienza lavorativa in Data Science (o un PhD);
  • Esperienza con tecniche di Machine Learning / AI;
  • Dimestichezza con Python e principali librerie di ML;
  • Curiosità intellettuale, proattività, spirito imprenditoriale e gioco di squadra.


🏆Cosa ti offriamo

  • Buoni pasto;
  • Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa per te e per la tua famiglia;
  • Approccio ibrido: Ci piace trascorrere dei momenti insieme in Casa X, il nostro ufficio nel 💚 di Milano, che sono l'occasione per fare finalmente una pausa caffè, partecipare a workshop e parlarsi senza essere in mute! Ci piace anche prenderci dei momenti in solitaria da remoto per quella presentazione piena di numeri che richiede un alto grado di concentrazione;
  • L’opportunità unica di partecipare attivamente al nostro sviluppo e alla nostra crescita partendo dalle fondamenta;
  • La possibilità di costruire la tua professionalità interfacciandoti con colleghi di grande esperienza nel panorama bancario e digitale italiano;
  • Un ambiente di lavoro altamente sfidante e davvero formativo, in cui il tuo contributo sarà fondamentale.


Valutiamo con molta attenzione tutte le candidature ricevute e apprezziamo moltissimo l’interesse per il nostro progetto. Se questa opportunità sarà allineata al tuo profilo sarai presto ricontattat*. Altrimenti terremo presente il tuo profilo anche per future ricerche.


Luogo di lavoro Milano

Title: EU Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: EU Data Scientist

Location: Hybrid, Lisbon

Competitive salary and benefits




Join one of Europe's largest B2B used vehicle service




At BCA, we’re altogether, more. More than just your average vehicle remarketing company. More than just any other place to work. We’re Europe's largest vehicle remarketing business, the backbone of the automotive supply chain.




The BCA EU business is now at an exciting turning point in their ambitions for how data can enhance their customer proposition. This role is part of a significant investment in strengthen the Decision Intelligence capability in the EU business, through a continuous development and maintenance of the Data Warehouse, expanding our use of Data Science & Machine learning solutions, developing new dashboards and fostering the adoption of these tools by the business users, promoting efficiencies and generating added value.




As a Data Scientist working for BCA, you’ll be responsible for the development, maintenance and improvement of our machine learning data products in the EU using our best-in-class framework. Furthermore, from starting with simple proofs of concept through to model refinement and deployment you’ll be involved in the development of new data products for the EU business.

The ideal candidate will have experience of statistical learning approaches e.g regression, tree-based approaches, time-series methods, clustering, etc, and will be innovative in model development and naturally curious, willing to try new approaches.




Solutions will be built using BCA’s best of breed Data Science solution (Python, SQL Server, Git, Databricks, MLflow, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Data Lake, Azure DevOps Services and Azure Kubernetes Services).







Role Accountabilities:




Ensure the on-going accuracy of BCA’s valuation models through the development of predictive models and machine learning approaches, experimenting with new ideas to further enhance our BCA Valuation product-set.
Utilise models to provide pricing intelligence to key stakeholders ensuring the direction of the market in each country is understood.
Explain the implications of models and model insights to business stakeholders and external customers in an easy-to-understand way.
Be able to identify and suggest new opportunities where the Data Science Team can add value to the BCA EU business.




Knowledge and Experience:




Experience of using a statistical language to build data products, preferably Python or R.
An added advantage is experience with a well-rounded stack of data science libraries, such as NumPy, Scikit-learn, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, Statsmodels, and XGBoost, to effectively clean, preprocess, transform, model, and visualize datasets.
Experience in object-oriented programming and package building is valued.
Knowledge of a machine learning approaches to model data (supervised/unsupervised analysis). E.g. Logistic regression, general linear models, decision trees, deep learning, cluster analysis, etc.
Exposure to data pipelines for both model training, evaluation and reporting/analytical purposes.
Use of cloud infrastructure to deploy model to a production environment would be beneficial.
Experience of using SQL to extract data from source systems.
Interest in data visualization tools, such as PowerBi, for model performance monitoring is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, including the confidence to present to key stakeholders.
Excellent written & oral communication skills, with an ability to interact with all levels of end users and technical resources.
Strong attention to detail and proactive in identifying and owning issues as they arise.Able to get up to speed quickly in understanding of the business metadata
To question the status quo and suggest possible improvements in the processes (harnessing automation where possible)







Our policy is to employ the best qualified people and provide equal opportunity for the advancement of employees including promotion and training and not to discriminate against any person because of gender, race, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion, belief or disability.







Thank you for your interest in working for us. Unfortunately, due to the volume of responses we cannot reply to every applicant, if you haven't heard from us in two weeks please assume you have not been successful.

Location: Hybrid, Lisbon

Competitive salary and benefits


Join one of Europe's largest B2B used vehicle service


At BCA, we’re altogether, more. More than just your average vehicle remarketing company. More than just any other place to work. We’re Europe's largest vehicle remarketing business, the backbone of the automotive supply chain.

Title: AI/ML Engineer (Eastern Europe)
Description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to build efficient, data-driven artificial intelligence systems that advance our predictive automation capabilities. The candidate should be highly skilled in statistics and programming, with the ability to confidently assess, analyze, and organize large amounts of data. The candidate should also be able to execute tests and optimize Proximity's machine-learning models and algorithms. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, data science, and software development and will work closely with our product, data science, and engineering teams to develop, deploy, and maintain machine learning models that drive our vision.

Requirements

you will be responsible for -


Designing, developing, testing, and deploying machine learning models for various applications
Collaborating with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to develop data-driven features
Optimizing and improving the performance of existing machine learning models
Implementing and maintaining scalable machine learning pipelines and infrastructure
Analyzing and preprocessing large datasets to extract valuable insights and features
Staying updated with the latest developments in machine learning, deep learning, and related technologies
Conducting model training, validation, and performance evaluation to ensure models meet the required accuracy and reliability
Creating and maintaining documentation related to machine learning models, algorithms, and processes
Developing A/B testing frameworks and managing the deployment of models in production



What You Need -


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or a related field
4+ years of experience in AI and Machine learning
Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, or in a similar role
Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages
Proficiency with machine learning libraries and frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit learn, etc and experience with NLP libraries (e.g., NLTK, spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers)
Experience with data preprocessing, data wrangling, and data visualization
Hands-on experience with SQL databases and API integration
Experience with text generation techniques, including language models like GPT
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and deploying models in production
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms, deep learning architectures, and statistical methods
Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines
Ability to work in a collaborative environment and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams



bonus points for -


Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) and its applications
Experience with MLOps tools and best practices for scalable model deployment and monitoring
Familiarity with data privacy and security regulations
Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies
Experience with reinforcement learning, generative models, or unsupervised learning techniques



Benefits

what you get -


Best in class salary: We hire only the best, and we pay accordingly
Proximity Talks: Meet other designers, engineers, and product geeks — and learn from experts in the field
Keep on learning with a world-class team: Work with the best in the field, challenge yourself constantly, and learn something new every day



About Us -

Proximity is the trusted technology, design, and consulting partner for some of the biggest Sports, Media and Entertainment companies in the world! We're headquartered in San Francisco and have offices in Palo Alto, Dubai, Mumbai, and Bangalore. Since 2019, Proximity has created and grown high-impact, scalable products used by 370 million daily users, with a total net worth of $45.7 billion among our client companies.

We are Proximity — a global team of coders, designers, product managers, geeks, and experts. We solve complex problems and build cutting edge tech, at scale. Our team of Proxonauts is growing quickly, which means your impact on the company's success will be huge. You'll have the chance to work with experienced leaders who have built and led multiple tech, product and design teams. Here's a quick guide to getting to know us better:


Watch our CEO, Hardik Jagda, tell you all about Proximity
Read about Proximity's values and meet some of our Proxonauts here
Explore our website, blog, and the design wing — Studio Proximity
Get behind-the-scenes with us on Instagram! Follow @ProxWrks and @H.Jagda

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We're seeking a Data Scientist with a strong background in building document analysis applications using LLMs (OpenAI API) and/or rule-based methods. You'll leverage Python, SQL, handle various document formats, implement RAG and Knowledge Graphs, work with Azure Document Intelligence, and develop REST APIs. Strong coding and communication skills are essential.




Job Description:-

Responsibilities:

Develop document analysis applications using LLMs and/or rules.
Process PDF, Excel, Word files; implement RAG and Knowledge Graphs.
Utilize OpenAI API and Azure Document Intelligence.
Build REST APIs and Python applications with strong coding practices.
Collaborate and communicate effectively.

Qualifications:

Strong Python and SQL skills.
Experience with LLMs (OpenAI API), RAG, and document handling.
Software development experience with REST APIs.
Good communication skills.

Nice to Have: Databricks, insurance/cyber knowledge.




About Us:

Ascendion is a global, leading provider of AI-first software engineering services, delivering transformative solutions across North America, APAC, and Europe. We are headquartered in New Jersey. We combine technology and talent to deliver tech debt relief, improve engineering productivity solutions, and accelerate time to value, driving our clients’ digital journeys with efficiency and velocity. Guided by our “Engineering to the power of AI” [EngineeringAI] methodology, we integrate AI into software engineering, enterprise operations, and talent orchestration, to address critical challenges of trust, speed, and capital. For more information, please go to www.ascendion.com




With Ascendion (www.ascendion.com), you:

Will get to work on numerous challenging and exciting projects on our various offerings including Salesforce, AI/Data Science, Generative AI/ML, Automation, Cloud Enterprise and Product/Platform Engineering.
At Ascendion you have high chances of project extension or redeployment to other clients.
Additionally, you can also share CV of anyone you know. We have a referral policy in place.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist (12-Month Contract, Fully Remote in the EU)




Compensation: $5,000 USD per month (Gross)




Job Overview:

We are seeking a Data Scientist to develop data-powered services that enhance our product, Subito, making it smarter and more intuitive. You will apply advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques to extract valuable insights from vast datasets. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will design and deploy innovative solutions that optimize user experiences and drive key business metrics.




Key Responsibilities:

Drive data-driven product design by analyzing multiple data sources to generate insights and recommendations.
Develop, train, and deploy Machine Learning models to improve user engagement and optimize business performance.
Leverage diverse datasets (in collaboration with Data Engineers) to uncover patterns and deliver actionable intelligence.
Formulate hypotheses and design experiments to validate and refine model performance in production environments.
Democratize data across the organization by creating automated reports and dashboards for key stakeholders.




Experience & Qualifications:

3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist working with large datasets in production environments.
Strong foundation in applied statistical techniques, model building, and hypothesis testing.
Mastery of Python for data manipulation and ML frameworks (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, etc.), with familiarity in prototyping tools like Streamlit.
Hands-on experience designing, training, and deploying ML models at scale.
Advanced data extraction skills using SQL, Spark, and related technologies.
Familiarity with software development tools (Cloud infrastructure, Git, Docker, etc.) and best practices.
Experience building and optimizing large-scale data pipelines and ETL processes with Spark.
Knowledge of CI/CD for ML, experiment tracking, and model serving (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow).
Git: Proficient in branching, merging, and pull request workflows.
Docker: Experience in containerizing ML solutions for efficient development and deployment.
Ability to lead projects from conception to production with minimal supervision.
Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders.
Advanced English level (written and verbal communication).




Nice to Have:

Terraform: Basic exposure to Infrastructure as Code principles for automating resource provisioning.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Data&AI, Machine Learning Team)
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams . We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster !

Machine Learning Engineer (Data&AI, Machine Learning Team)

As a Machine Learning Engineer within the Data&AI department, you will be at the forefront of developing and refining machine learning models that drive key aspects of our business. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Product and Engineering teams, to deliver impactful solutions across various domains, from personalized product recommendations and ad relevance to pricing optimization, sales forecasting, or inventory management. Your role will involve both research and hands-on model development, ensuring our algorithms remain innovative and scalable in a fast-paced environment.

What You’ll Have To Do


Develop cutting-edge techniques for fields like search, personalization, advertising, forecasting, optimization, and agent-based automation.
Dive deep into massive datasets, uncovering hidden patterns and insights through exploratory analysis and advanced analytical techniques.
Design and build machine learning models using state-of-the-art techniques, adapting them for real-world production environments and optimizing for business needs and engineering constraints.
Write high-quality production code for training and inference, ensuring seamless data validation, efficient logging, reliable exception handling, and smooth orchestration for optimal performance.


What Makes You a Good Fit


Have a degree in a related discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science).
Have hands-on experience with TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Are proficient in SQL and have a solid understanding of relational databases.
Have a passion for diving into large datasets, asking the right questions, and uncovering insights.
Have strong problem-solving skills, especially when it comes to complex technical challenges.
Can clearly communicate technical concepts and translate them into business-focused insights for both technical and management audiences.
Have expertise in areas like Anomaly Detection, Time Series Analysis, Unsupervised Learning, Probabilistic Graphical Models, Recommender Systems, and Semantic Search.
Have a strong collaborative mindset, working seamlessly with interdisciplinary teams to tackle tough problems.
Have a solid grasp of big data architecture and application design.


What We’ve Prepared For You


Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist Intern
Description:
Data Scientist Intern




Alkemy è una società internazionale specializzata nell’evoluzione del modello di business di grandi e medie aziende e una public company quotata sul mercato MTA STAR di Borsa Italiana.

La nostra mission è di migliorare la posizione di mercato e la competitività delle grandi e medie aziende stimolando l’evoluzione del modello di business in coerenza con l’innovazione tecnologica e i comportamenti dei consumatori. Grazie a un team di oltre 1000 persone, integriamo competenze nelle aree di Strategy, Communication, Design, Performance, Technology, Insights & Analytics con un’offerta, pensata per il contesto post-digital, che copre l’intera catena del valore dalla strategia all’implementazione.




IL RUOLO




Per il potenziamento dell’area di Data & Analytics (former Nunatac SpA), Alkemy è alla ricerca di un Neolaureati e Laureandi da inserire come Data Scientist Intern. La Mission di questa area è di accompagnare le aziende nel loro percorso di crescita, aiutandole a fondare la propria strategia sui dati e sulla conoscenza che da essi deriva. È composta da Data Scientists e Data Engineers che formano un team dinamico, informale e rigoroso al lavoro su applicazioni di Advanced Analytics innovative e di valore.

Lavorare nell’area Data & Analytics significa affrontare tutte le sfide legate all'uso di metodi quantitativi, dalle tecniche statistiche consolidate agli approcci pionieristici di Machine Learning e Deep Learning applicati ai Big Data, per ottenere un impatto reale sul business dei nostri clienti. Siamo in continua crescita e cerchiamo nuove persone che sappiano combinare le competenze tecniche con la visione, l'intraprendenza e la passione per i dati.




Sede di lavoro: Milano

Esperienza: Neolaureati o laureandi (meno di 6 mesi dalla prova finale)

Area: Data & Analytics




REQUISITI NECESSARI




Laurea in ambito scientifico (statistica, matematica, fisica, economia. informatica)
Forte interesse in ambito gestione ed analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics, machine/deep learning
Curiosità e proattività
Ottima capacità di lavorare in gruppo
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese




NICE TO HAVE




Conoscenza di SQL e, anche base, del mondo SAS, R e Python




Stage retribuito finalizzato all'inserimento in Azienda.




COSA OFFRIAMO




In Alkemy ci impegniamo costantemente nel creare le migliori condizioni affinché tutte le nostre persone sentano di poter esprimere al meglio il proprio valore ed il proprio talento - e possano sentire Alkemy come casa propria - indipendentemente da genere, età, nazionalità, orientamento sessuale e religioso.

Siamo da sempre profondamente convinti che un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo che valorizzi tutte le diversità sia non solo un imperativo valoriale, ma un fattore critico di successo per il nostro business. Aggreghiamo sotto lo stesso tetto persone con professionalità e background molto diversi e da sempre promuoviamo una cultura di condivisione e crescita continua.

Eccellenza, Passione, Integrità e Concretezza sono i valori fondanti di Alkemy, che tutti noi condividiamo e che ci guidano nel realizzare la nostra mission. I valori Alkemy definiscono la nostra identità e sono alla base della nostra cultura organizzativa, indirizzano i nostri comportamenti nei confronti di tutte le nostre persone e dei nostri clienti, costruendo evolutivamente il nostro approccio al business.

I profili ritenuti in linea verranno contattati entro 20 giorni. Non saranno valutate candidature sprovviste di cv completo allegato. I dati dei candidati verranno trattati ai sensi dell’Informativa Privacy sempre consultabile sul nostro sito.alkemy.com

Show more
HTML:
Data Scientist Intern


Alkemy è una società internazionale specializzata nell’evoluzione del modello di business di grandi e medie aziende e una public company quotata sul mercato MTA STAR di Borsa Italiana.

La nostra mission è di migliorare la posizione di mercato e la competitività delle grandi e medie aziende stimolando l’evoluzione del modello di business in coerenza con l’innovazione tecnologica e i comportamenti dei consumatori. Grazie a un team di oltre 1000 persone, integriamo competenze nelle aree di Strategy, Communication, Design, Performance, Technology, Insights & Analytics con un’offerta, pensata per il contesto post-digital, che copre l’intera catena del valore dalla strategia all’implementazione.


IL RUOLO


Per il potenziamento dell’area di Data & Analytics (former Nunatac SpA), Alkemy è alla ricerca di un Neolaureati e Laureandi da inserire come Data Scientist Intern. La Mission di questa area è di accompagnare le aziende nel loro percorso di crescita, aiutandole a fondare la propria strategia sui dati e sulla conoscenza che da essi deriva. È composta da Data Scientists e Data Engineers che formano un team dinamico, informale e rigoroso al lavoro su applicazioni di Advanced Analytics innovative e di valore.

Lavorare nell’area Data & Analytics significa affrontare tutte le sfide legate all'uso di metodi quantitativi, dalle tecniche statistiche consolidate agli approcci pionieristici di Machine Learning e Deep Learning applicati ai Big Data, per ottenere un impatto reale sul business dei nostri clienti. Siamo in continua crescita e cerchiamo nuove persone che sappiano combinare le competenze tecniche con la visione, l'intraprendenza e la passione per i dati.


Sede di lavoro: Milano

Esperienza: Neolaureati o laureandi (meno di 6 mesi dalla prova finale)

Area: Data & Analytics


REQUISITI NECESSARI


  • Laurea in ambito scientifico (statistica, matematica, fisica, economia. informatica)
  • Forte interesse in ambito gestione ed analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics, machine/deep learning
  • Curiosità e proattività
  • Ottima capacità di lavorare in gruppo
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese


NICE TO HAVE


  • Conoscenza di SQL e, anche base, del mondo SAS, R e Python


Stage retribuito finalizzato all'inserimento in Azienda.


COSA OFFRIAMO


In Alkemy ci impegniamo costantemente nel creare le migliori condizioni affinché tutte le nostre persone sentano di poter esprimere al meglio il proprio valore ed il proprio talento - e possano sentire Alkemy come casa propria - indipendentemente da genere, età, nazionalità, orientamento sessuale e religioso.

Siamo da sempre profondamente convinti che un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo che valorizzi tutte le diversità sia non solo un imperativo valoriale, ma un fattore critico di successo per il nostro business. Aggreghiamo sotto lo stesso tetto persone con professionalità e background molto diversi e da sempre promuoviamo una cultura di condivisione e crescita continua.

Eccellenza, Passione, Integrità e Concretezza sono i valori fondanti di Alkemy, che tutti noi condividiamo e che ci guidano nel realizzare la nostra mission. I valori Alkemy definiscono la nostra identità e sono alla base della nostra cultura organizzativa, indirizzano i nostri comportamenti nei confronti di tutte le nostre persone e dei nostri clienti, costruendo evolutivamente il nostro approccio al business.

I profili ritenuti in linea verranno contattati entro 20 giorni. Non saranno valutate candidature sprovviste di cv completo allegato. I dati dei candidati verranno trattati ai sensi dell’Informativa Privacy sempre consultabile sul nostro sito.alkemy.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Match Profiler is an Information Systems consultant who has been working in the national and international market since 1999. We have multidisciplinary skills and IT know-how that allow us to contribute, optimize and progress with our clients.

We are currently recruiting, for integration in our internal team/client, professionals with the following profile:




Data Scientist (m/f) – Hybrid (Lisbon)




What do you need to have:

Hard Skills:

• Higher education in a STEM related field, with major statistics or mathematics components

• Five to ten years of experience in Data Science / ML projects

• Professional experience in end-to-end data science / machine learning initiatives, encompassing data understanding, preparation, modelling and evaluation, and deployment. This is mandatory.

• Senior Level - Solid command of data science concepts and principles - especially around EDA, modelling and evaluation - is mandatory.

• Professional experience with Python and industry standard Python data science / ML frameworks (e.g. scikit, pytorch, keras, opencv, pandas, others) is mandatory

• Professional experience in data preparation/transformation (e.g. SQL, pandas) is mandatory.

• Professional experience working with a cloud environment is mandatory, AWS highly preferred.

• Experience with LLM, RAG, and Generative AI technologies is highly preferred.

• Professional experience with Databricks is highly valued

• Excellent fluency in English, written and spoken, is mandatory. All business discussions will be conducted in English.




Soft skills

• Good communication

• Team spirit

• Proactivity

• Time management




What we can offer:

• Personalized support from your team

• Your manager will take into consideration your motivations and suggestions

• Victories will be celebrated together

• Your HR and Support Teams will always be available to help

• Constant feedback on your work

• A network of hundreds of partnerships with companies from numerous sectors that offer you exclusive discounts (health, well-being, travel, gastronomy, culture, leisure, training, etc)

• And, of course, many gatherings and social events




To respond to this opportunity, send us your CV to the following e-mail address rita.marques@m-profiler.pt

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world’s leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of Aon, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




What you will do

We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science team. Our mission is to drive innovation and leverage machine learning and data-driven solutions to solve strategic business challenges. You will work across various domains, including product, sales, marketing, and operations, impacting business outcomes at scale. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and is passionate about learning and leveraging data science to create real-world impact.




A typical day

Develop predictive models, advanced analytics solutions, and visualization tools for internal teams and end customers. Initial projects may include: scoring models for sales and customer service, recommendation systems, automation of repetitive tasks to improve efficiency.
Conduct complex analyses for business stakeholders, translating insights into actionable recommendations.
Own the feedback loop for testing and improving machine learning models.
Design, propose, and measure A/B tests for product features, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Identify data-driven opportunities to enhance different stages of the customer journey.
Collaborate with data engineering and infrastructure teams to develop scalable, end-to-end solutions.
Serve as a technical representative when engaging with external stakeholders.
Recommend and implement new technologies, processes, and systems to optimize efficiencies and business performance.
Maintain awareness of emerging trends in data science, machine learning, and technology.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
Produce detailed technical documentation and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.




What you need to succeed

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.
Around 4 - 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist
Strong communication skills to translate technical analysis into business insights.
Extensive experience with Python and data visualization frameworks (e.g., Plotly, Seaborn, Matplotlib).
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data modeling and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, etc.).
Experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment processes.
Solid understanding of clean code principles and version control (Git).
Knowledge of Docker and containerization technologies.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
Nice to have: Experience in designing and measuring A/B tests.
Nice to have: Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications.
Nice to have: Knowledge of best practices around service-oriented architectures or microservices.




About the recruitment process

Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let’s move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the colleagues from the Data Science team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day life is and its responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Scientist as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level and you will have a maximum of 7 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet one of our Heads of Data and Engineering, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet

At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure…




💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
⏰ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it’s up to you!
🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
📚 Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500€ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
🛒 Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform (BigPocket) on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
🏝 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
🍏 Great offices in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
Description

Founded in 1969, Pharmathen has grown to become one of the largest, vertically integrated developers of complex drug delivery technologies and is among the top 50 pharmaceutical research companies in Europe.

The company has one of the most extensive and advanced pipelines of long acting injectables (LAI), sustained release and ophthalmic formulations.

Pharmathen’s highly diversified portfolio consists of over 90 commercialized products, which are produced in its US FDA and EU-approved manufacturing facilities in Greece, serving 250 customers and accessed by patients in more than 90 countries worldwide.

Pharmathen proudly employs more than 1,600 people from over 28 different nationalities, with 54% of its total workforce and 66% of its Research Operations Team being female. The company’s enduring success is attributed to a passion for creativity, strong ethics, and the dedication of its people, who share a commitment to the company's vision of making a difference in people’s lives.

Due to continuous growth and expansion, Pharmathen Pharmaceuticals offers a great opportunity for career development and is seeking to attract a Research Scientist to join our Stability team at Pharmathen’s Pallini premises.

As a Research Scientist you will provide high quality support in analytical and formulation development in a GLP environment. You will also support all stages of a new product development through preparation and analysis of R&D formulations.

More Particularly

What you’ll do:


Work on R&D projects for new or old products and perform various tests on product based on laboratory procedures. Record Data, observations, and conclusions
Deliver, evaluate and interpret experimental data
Keep accurate and detailed handwritten or electronic records on laboratory data
Check the laboratory loggers and update respective electronic database. Calibration of internally calibrated instrumentation based on schedule (daily,weekly etc)
Maintain and follow all laboratory systems, GMPS
Follow the rules as defined in the relevant EU and FDA guidelines
Adheres to safety and housekeeping requirements
Assumes other activities and responsibilities as directed


Requirements

The ideal candidate should have:


BSc Degree in Chemistry or relevant field /Technical institution degree
At least 2 years of practical knowledge gained through experience accompanied by a technical or vocational training
0- 2 years of experience in the Pharmaceutical Industry or equivalent experience


Job-Specific Skills


Excellent communication in English language (writing & speaking)
Computer literacy
Troubleshooting skills
Competent in analytical method development techniques (HPLC, GC,etc) and production lab instrumentation
Demonstrated ability to work on multiple projects and meet timelines


Benefits

What you'll gain:


Involvement in a high-caliber, team-oriented and dynamic atmosphere
Exposure to challenging business issues and practices
Great opportunity to leverage and develop your business knowledge and skills


Join our team and experience the unique Pharmathen’s culture that gives you the opportunity to innovate, to make decisions, to achieve your own potential and to chart your own career!

Pharmathen is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications regardless of gender, race, age, religion, sexual orientation, and national origin.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Scientist to join us in Lisbon.




Must Have:

Higher education in a STEM related field, with major statistics or mathematics components
Five to ten years of experience in Data Science / ML projects
Professional experience in end-to-end data science / machine learning initiatives, encompassing data understanding, preparation, modelling and evaluation, and deployment. This is mandatory.
Level - Solid command of data science concepts and principles - especially around EDA, modelling and evaluation - is mandatory.
Excellent fluency in English, written and spoken, is mandatory. All business discussions will be conducted in English.
Professional experience with Python and industry standard Python data science / ML frameworks (e.g. Professional experience in data preparation/transformation (e.g. SQL, pandas) is mandatory.
Professional experience working with a cloud environment is mandatory, AWS highly preferred.
Experience with LLM, RAG, and Generative AI technologies is highly preferred.
Professional experience with Databricks is highly valued




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV to joana.ramos@decskill.com







Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.
